string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.
To preview this video, use the Preview functionality in Storyline, republish your course using standard MP4 video, or publish to Review 360.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.

slidelink.displaytext: Introduction to General Ledger and Journal Types

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

resource.title: Chart of Accounts Quick Reference Guide

terms.term: A General Ledger is a record-keeping system of an organization’s financial data. It keeps track of financial transactions and is used to prepare financial reports.
A journal entry is the mechanism for recording financial transactions into the General Ledger.
Subledger Accounting (SLA) is an automated process in Oracle that rolls detailed subledger information up to the General Ledger as a summary.
A subledger is a ledger containing a sub-set of transactions. In Oracle, transactions (and all relevant details) are posted in subledgers.
